name: Hotel Villa Liberty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel and a free parking spot right a away. As others have said, it is a bit of a walk to the center, but with all the pasta and vino that's perfect for us. The room was facing the garden so fairly quiet. The bathrooms were updated (small shower, but it worked well) which was a perk. Front desk staff and breakfast person were wonderful. We had some of the best espresso and cappuccino of our five week trip with the breakfast. Breakfast included homemade bread, cereals, yogurt, a warming tray of scrambled eggs and bacon (we did not have these), and fresh- squeezed orange juice (!). One downside for me was that the bedding seemed to have waterproof sheeting underneath the top sheet - made me uncomfortably warm.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for easy parking, wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good choice if you are up to walking!
reviews.title: Great hotel with lots of charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Villa Liberty has been a favorite of my wife and I, since we first visited in 2006. Since that time the hotel has gone through updates that make it a better place. Located away from the center of Siena, the hotel may be a bit of a walk for some people but one we enjoyed each night we returned. There is a nice park across the street to sit and enjoy and walking into town there are a couple places where you can stand and get great views of Siena.
reviews.title: A warm hotel feel like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel staff is very courteous and professional, and they will attend to any problems you experience quickly. The nightly rates for the hotel are very reasonable. Our room was a bit on the small side but not unbearable. There was no space to lay out our open bags as the very large bed took up the majority of the space. The bed was the most comfortable we experienced throughout our entire trip in Italy, as well as the best pillows and sheets. The bathroom was nicely updated, and while the shower was quite small, it was also very relaxing.
reviews.title: Adequate Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: We love Villa Liberty for its charm; the fact that you use an actual key to open your door, and the yellow marble staircase in the lobby. But with charm also comes quirks, like the desk chair that didn’t fit under the desk thus taking up space in the room. Overall this is a great hotel however. The breakfast in the morning didn’t have much variety but still nice. People are quiet and courteous and aside from the size of the room we had no problems. We would recommend that if you are staying in Siena for few nights to go with the biggest room available as the space will be appreciated. One day we’ll return to Siena and Hotel Villa Liberty will still be our first choice.
reviews.title: Perfect Road Trip Stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: L'hotel è molto carino. E' ubicato in una strada che termina con un panorama su Siena molto bello. E' facile raggiungere il centro di Siena a piedi e all'esterno si può tranquillamente parcheggiare l'auto gratuitamente. Le camere sono pulite e confortevoli. La colazione è molto buona! Staff gentile! Lo consiglio vivamente.
reviews.title: Siena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great location right across from the fortezza and a short walk to the walled city and Piazza del Campo and the Duomo. The rooms and bathrooms are very small, even by European standards, but plush and immaculate. You get the feeling you are houseguests in an opulent villa. Our room had a nice balcony (I think it was 205).
reviews.title: wonderful little boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Julia worked the desk in the evenings when we were there and she was so helpful. We had lost our passports and she spent a lot of time on the internet for us researching what to do and where we should go to replace them. She really went above and beyond and took some of the stress off us by printing out specific instructions including a map of where the consulate in Florence was and their hours.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Siena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The included breakfast was very nice. The fresh squeezed orange juice was wonderful.
reviews.title: very good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Siena. We stayed just steps away from il Campo last time and finding good value was challenging. The 10 minute walk from this hotel was worth every step. Great rooms, nice bathrooms, comfortable bed, nice location, delicious breakfast. We had a room off the street and it was very quiet. Couple scuffs on the floor/walls but not bad if they continue to stay on top of things.
reviews.title: " WONDERFUL LOCATION"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in early September 2011. Unfortunately we arrived later than expected due to a transit strike. We had no issues checking in at the hotel despite our travel delays. The hotel is ideally situated 10 minutes from the city center and about the same distance from the main enoteca. The hotel itsel is quaint, very modern and clean, and has a lovely breakfast area with seating inside or outside in the garden. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. We had no issues with noise, which other reviewers have mentioned. We loved Siena and would definitely stay here again if we have the opportunity to return.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is soooooo great!!! It is very clean, comfortable and the rooms are so big and well decorated!!! I simply loved it. It is a short walk away from the city centre but it is worth it!! The city is also wonderful!! Siena is a great place to visit!!!!
reviews.title: A dream come true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights during the Winter of 2011. I had a small suite on the ground floor. Although the windows faced the street through the garden and there was a bit of street noise, it was not annoying. Sad that I did not have direct access to the garden as the door from my room that led outside had been permanently locked, but the garden space outside was lovely as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful (two out of three of the ones I met while there) and also friendly in a genuine way, something that counts for a lot for me. The room was beautifuly furnished, the bed very comfortable and luxurious, the bathroom oh-so-cool with a very modern shower.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location but Difficult to Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ok, a bit of a walk into town, but not bad if you like walking, and probably better if you are driving as there is some on-street parking in the area.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ten minutes from the centre and very close to the central bus station. Our room, in the ground floor, was average with a pleasant decor but the noise from the water pipes from the next door room was very noticeable and rather annoying. Bed was very comfy and shower was good. Breakfast was also good, with freshly squeezed orange juice, which was a nice surprise. Staff seem nice enough. All in all, this was a bit pricey for a room 10 mins walk away from the centre and at the end of October. Would only stay here again if price went at least 20 euros down (we paid 120 for a standard room).
reviews.title: A bit pricey for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel close to San Domenico good choice if you get lost in Siena. San Domenico directions are everywhere.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel rooms are comfortable, beds are comy too, rooms come with fridge and AC; breakfast is nice served in the garden patio.
reviews.title: Good overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking can be a problem some days so you might have to park some distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, misleading parking and unhelpful customer service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff can be a little indifferent and not too many smiles. One night after dinner in Siena we bought some wine and decided to sit at a table in the garden with our wine (two couples). We went through the only door to the garden and before we could even sit; a young woman came out to tell us that the exit we used was for staff of the hotel only! So how do we get to the garden, we asked. She told us to go out the hotel entrance and around the outside of the building to the side gate. We looked at each other in disbelief and asked why would we do that when there is a doorway right there. Just then another member of the hotel staff appeared and told us that it was ok to use the doorway to the garden.
reviews.title: perfect location, perfect atmosphere

description: Located just outside the ancient walls of the historic centre of Siena, the Villa Liberty is 10 minutes' walk from Piazza del Campo. You can reach the hotel easily by car, and walk as far as the unique medieval centre of city in few minutes. This converted 19th-century villa retains the charm and ambiance of its former origins as a private residence.The 18 Villa Liberty rooms are all furnished elegantly.
